info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...AREAS OF BLACK ICE CAUSING TREACHEROUS ROAD CONDITIONS TONIGHT... A winter storm affected much of the region with ice, snow, and sleet Saturday night and Sunday. Roads became wet in many areas as temperatures warmed Sunday afternoon, but as temperatures fall overnight those roads are likely to become icy again. Slippery, treacherous road conditions may persist in some areas into Monday morning. Transportation agencies are advising the public to stay off roads unless absolutely necessary. Any motorists that do venture out are urged to use extreme caution. If a road looks wet, it likely is covered in a thin sheet of ice.
